subject: RE: [junit] web testing
msgSnippet: The problem I found with HttpUnit is that when parsing a link it complained unknown protocol .  I imagine if you use a
messageBody:
The problem I found with HttpUnit is that when parsing a <a href="javascript:myfunc()">link</a> it complained 'unknown protocol'.  I imagine if you use a sofisticated DHTML interface your best using javascript within the browser to do the button pressing.
 
Dave
-----Original Message-----
From: Jim Cheesman [mailto:jchees@...]
Sent: 04 May 2001 08:45
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] web testing

At 01:42 AM 04/05/01, you wrote:
>Is there a good testbed for web testing (pushing buttons, follow links
>etc)??


HttpUnit will do "black box" web testing - the kind of thing you mention.
There's a link to it from the junit.org homepage. Cactus (at
jakarta.apache) will do server-side unit testing.

HTH,
Jim
